# The description of the data used in the study

*The survey used data collected in spring 2025 from four cities in four countries*

# Download the file

`{r} download.file( url = "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/tdscience/course/main/data/people.csv", destfile = "data/people.csv" )`

## *Check what the data looks like*

```{r}
people <- read.csv("data/people.csv")
head(people)
```
*Remove all data that isn't right*

```{r}
people_unique <- people %>% distinct()

nrow(people_unique)
```

*Check how many people responded*


```{r}
library(dplyr)
str(people_unique)
nrow(people_unique)
```

*Check which animals are the most popular*

```{r}
people_unique %>% count(animal, sort = TRUE)
```
